metadata.synopsis: This covers arts three states 1) Thaniel is dead, which means the curse cannot be lifted [he is heartbroken and grieving] 2) the curse quest is in progress, and Thaniel hasn't been saved yet [he's worried for thaniel and frantic] and 3) curse has been lifted and Thaniel is safe [Art is grateful and contemplative, but also a little reserved - he knows he's going to die soon]
metadata.how_to_trigger: Cure Art Cullagh in Haven or use oe SCE_CureArtCullagh

3.speaker: Art Cullagh
3.text: Thank you, my friend. Maybe we'll meet again, in another life.

8.speaker: Art Cullagh
8.text: Don't worry about me, please focus on saving Thaniel.

38.speaker: Art Cullagh
38.text: Any word on Thaniel? And the curse?

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I just killed Ketheric and this is all you have to say?

27.speaker: Art Cullagh
27.text: Sorry, I didn't mean - I'm just worried.

71.speaker: Art Cullagh
71.text: Please, - I don't know how much longer Thaniel can last in the Shadowfell. Help him - and hurry.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Last I saw you were bed-bound. How did you make it here?

2.speaker: Art Cullagh
2.text: Duke Eltan would be proud of what the order has become. A pity they cannot spare the resources to help you with Thaniel.

77.speaker: Art Cullagh
77.text: With great difficulty. Even after all that rest, I... don't seem to be getting better.

43.speaker: Art Cullagh
43.text: And Thaniel has been trapped in that cursed darkness even longer than I. Please, help him. Please.

49.speaker: Art Cullagh
49.text: Please, hurry. I don't know how much longer Thaniel can last.

44.speaker: Art Cullagh
44.text: When Duke Eltan formed the Flaming Fist, he sought out people of courage and honour to fill its ranks.

14.speaker: Art Cullagh
14.text: You saved Thaniel, lifted the curse, and killed an immortal.

52.speaker: Art Cullagh
52.text: It's safe to say, you'd have been recruited in an instant.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Thank you - it would have been an honour to serve under Duke Eltan.

67.speaker: Art Cullagh
67.text: Of course, I have no idea what life is like under Duke Ravengard's rule.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: The Flaming Fist are nothing but mercenaries now. Immoral ones at that.

12.speaker: Art Cullagh
12.text: Maybe. I don't know what this Duke Ravengard is like.

47.speaker: Art Cullagh
47.text: But I've seen the respect he inspires in the Flaming Fist - and that tells me all I need about him as a leader.

54.speaker: Art Cullagh
54.text: I hope you can save Duke Ravengard - for the good of Baldur's Gate.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Come with me - I could use a Flaming Fist by my side.

72.speaker: Art Cullagh
72.text: Thank you, but look at me - I am a relic: a glimpse of history barely strong enough to stand on his own two feet.

57.speaker: Art Cullagh
57.text: Besides - Thaniel should have someone here when he wakes up. It's the least I can do.

24.speaker: Art Cullagh
24.text: When this land fell to the curse, I should have gone with it - Thaniel is the only reason I survived.

10.speaker: Art Cullagh
10.text: It's only fair I stay here and wait for him to awaken.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Then I wish you luck. Thank you for your help.

22.speaker: Art Cullagh
22.text: You too, my friend. Thank you - from Thaniel and I.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Once we leave, this place will be pretty empty. Will you be all right?

6.speaker: Art Cullagh
6.text: You don't have to worry about me.

26.speaker: Art Cullagh
26.text: The truth is... the Shadowfell broke something inside me - something no healer can fix. I don't know how long I have.

41.speaker: Art Cullagh
41.text: But - because of you, Thaniel is safe. Because of you, I could help him, as he helped me. So thank you, my friend, and know that I have no regrets.

69.speaker: Art Cullagh
69.text: I don't think there will be an after.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I have enough to deal with - some useless duke isn't my problem.

32.speaker: Art Cullagh
32.text: I can't make you - nor can I go in your place. In truth... I do not know how much longer I will live. The Shadowfell's damage runs deep I fear.

9.speaker: Art Cullagh
9.text: So consider this a dying man's wish. Help Duke Ravengard... save the city. Please.

76.speaker: Art Cullagh
76.text: But the Flaming Fist are the cornerstone of the city, and the Dukes are the foundation.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: How did you make it here?

64.speaker: Art Cullagh
64.text: A Flaming Fist - a novice, actually. She dropped everything to make sure I made it here safe.

42.speaker: Art Cullagh
42.text: I heard about Duke Ravengard capture. If his soldiers are anything to go by, he is a man to admire and respect.

68.speaker: Art Cullagh
68.text: I hope you can save him - for the good of Baldur's Gate.

20.speaker: Art Cullagh
20.text: Luck and stubbornness. I'm still weak, so the walk took... longer than I'd like to admit. But my health can wait.

4.speaker: Art Cullagh
4.text: I heard about the Dead Three. And, more importantly, Duke Ravengard.

28.speaker: Art Cullagh
28.text: The Flaming Fist are the cornerstone of Baldur's Gate - and the Dukes are its foundation. I hope you can save him.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: What about the Flaming Fist you've met here? What do you think of them?

56.speaker: Art Cullagh
56.text: They are... different to what Duke Eltan envisioned.  And I can't comment on Duke Ravengard himself.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: I grew up hearing stories of Duke Eltan - I'm curious about what he was like.

51.speaker: Art Cullagh
51.text: Gruff. And intimidating. But he had the courage of ten men - and a love for Baldur's Gate few could match.

19.speaker: Art Cullagh
19.text: I don't know if this Duke Ravengard is the same, but I will say this - the Flaming Fist are the cornerstone of the city, and the Dukes are its foundation.

46.speaker: Art Cullagh
46.text: He's gone, I can feel it.

62.speaker: Art Cullagh
62.text: Thaniel is gone... and with him, any chance of breaking the curse.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Surely there's something we can still do.

58.speaker: Art Cullagh
58.text: No. When I first awoke, I felt him. Here. But that's faded.
58.context: NodeContext: touches heart on 'hear' , sad and distant

7.speaker: Player
7.text: You're alive - isn't that something to be grateful about?

33.speaker: Art Cullagh
33.text: I am, please don't mistake that. But saving me was in vain.

0.speaker: Art Cullagh
0.text: Ketheric was never my concern - I wanted to help Thaniel.

18.speaker: Art Cullagh
18.text: My friend is gone - lost to the darkness. And I... I think I am too. I feel it - deep inside.
18.context: NodeContext: heartbroken - he knows he's going to die soon

70.speaker: Art Cullagh
70.text: I didn't want to tell you in Last Light, but the Shadowfell... broke something in me - something no healer can fix.
70.context: NodeContext: a sad smile and shrug - he knows he's going to die

16.speaker: Art Cullagh
16.text: I hoped to save Thaniel, as he saved me. But it was all for nothing.

29.speaker: Art Cullagh
29.text: Thank you, for trying to help us. I'm sure Thaniel would feel the same - wherever he is now.

60.speaker: Art Cullagh
60.text: Don't be. The Shadowfell claims everyone in the end - it just took its time with me.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I never really cared about Thaniel anyway.
